Name: anode production, silicon coated graphite, NCA, for Li-ion battery | anode, silicon coated graphite, for Li-ion battery | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators
Description: This dataset incudes the production of an anode for a Li-ion battery with advance cathode material (i.e. nickel-cobalt-aluminium, NCA). Synthetic graphite as active material, silicon as coating material, carbon black as conductive additive, styrene butadiene (SBR) and carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC) as binder are mixed in ration 92:2:1:2:3. Deionized water is used as solvent to prepare the anode slurry. The input materials are mixed to form a slurry, then the mixture is dried with the solvent evaporating away, cut and calendered to form the cathode of a Li-ion battery. The energy required to coat the copper conductor foil with the anode slurry is included in this dataset, because it was not possible to separate it from the energy required for the drying step.
